FuncDef:
The binding pw ldp vsi command binds protocol VSI PWs to an L2VPN monitoring group.
The undo binding pw ldp vsi command unbinds protocol VSI PWs from an L2VPN monitoring group.
By default, no protocol VSI PWs are bound to an L2VPN monitoring group.
CLIs: binding pw ldp vsi <vsi-name> peer <peer-ip> pw-id <pw-id> encapsulation { vlan | ethernet }
undo binding pw ldp vsi <vsi-name> peer <peer-ip> pw-id <pw-id> encapsulation { vlan | ethernet }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IP address of a peer PE.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a PW ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Indicates the encapsulation type of a VSI.
-

Indicates that the encapsulation type is VLAN.
-

Indicates that the encapsulation type is Ethernet.
-

Indicates that LDP signaling is used.
-

Specifies a VSI name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-l2vpn-monitor-group-group1] binding pw ldp vsi vsi1 peer 1.1.1.1 pw-id 100 encapsulation ethernet
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To bind protocol VSI PWs to an L2VPN monitoring group and specify the PW encapsulation type, run the binding pw command.
Precautions
Static PWs cannot be bound to an L2VPN monitoring group.
Only LDP VSI PWs can be bound to an L2VPN monitoring group.
